title: Over 4,000 cops in Western Visayas to secure 'Tigkalalag 2025'

We will help them to recover, put them back on their feet and do what we can to make up for the loss that they have suffered,” Marcos said.

title: 80 Camarines Norte barangays isolated after Typhoon Uwan
summary: Several barangays in Camarines Norte were heavily battered by the powerful winds and rains from Typhoon Uwan, destroying homes and downing power lines that also affected the power supply in the province.

title: Fish swim inside houses in flood-stricken Hagonoy, Bulacan
summary: Fishes can now be found swimming inside flood-stricken houses in Hagonoy, Bulacan amid the onslaught of Typhoon Uwan.

title: Fire struck over 80 houses in Bato, Leyte
summary: At least 83 houses were razed in a fire in Barangay Iniguihan, Bato, Leyte.

title: Typhoon Uwan worsens floods caused by Tino in San Pablo City, Laguna
summary: It may take up to two weeks for the floods in some areas in the City of San Pablo, Laguna to subside after Typhoon Uwan worsened the previous floods caused by Typhoon Tino.

title: Senior citizen dies while rescuing pet cats in Catbalogan, Samar
summary: A 65-year-old woman died while she was rescuing her pet cats amid the onslaught of Typhoon Uwan in Catbalogan, Samar.

title: Vessel slams into seawall at island off Lapu-Lapu City
summary: A landing craft tank (LCT) rammed into the seawall of Caubian Island, off Lapu-Lapu City, dawn on November 10, 2025, as Super Typhoon Uwan barreled through Southern Luzon.

title: Cebu gov't submits records for probe into officials' alleged foreign trips amid Uwan
summary: The Cebu provincial government on Tuesday said documents have been submitted to the Department of the Interior and Local Government for the probe into the alleged foreign trips of some officials during the onslaught of Tropical Cyclone Uwan.

title: DOTr: Catanduanes seaports, airport damaged by Uwan
summary: The seaports in Catanduanes sustained extensive damage while an airport had minor damage after the onslaught of Tropical Cyclone Uwan, the Department of Transportation said on Tuesday.

title: Iloilo fire causes over P1.7M in damage
summary: A fire that broke out in several facilities in Guimbal, Iloilo, has caused over P1.7 million in damage, according to the Bureau of Fire Protection.

title: DOT: Cebu Province remains open to tourists after earthquake, strong typhoon
summary: The Department of Tourism (DOT) on Tuesday assured tourists that Cebu remains “open and ready” to welcome visitors despite recent disasters including Super Typhoon Uwan, widespread flooding from Typhoon Tino, and the magnitude 6.9 earthquake off the coast of Bogo City that affected some areas in the province.

title: Caloocan police captain robs Bulacan store, killed in shootout with cops
summary: A police captain assigned to Caloocan City died in a shootout with fellow cops after he robbed a convenience store in Marilao, Bulacan on Monday evening.

title: 4 men rob Bulacan fastfood resto during Uwan"s onslaught
summary: Authorities have arrested two of four men who robbed a branch of a fastfood chain in Bulacan as then Super Typhoon Uwan was starting to batter parts of the country.

title: Dike in Obando, Bulacan heavily damaged due to Uwan
summary: Severe Tropical Storm Uwan, which peaked into a super typhoon, damaged a dike near the boundary of Barangay Lawa and Paco in Obando, Bulacan.

title: Girl stuffed into sack in Iloilo positive for abuse
summary: The seven-year-old girl in Lambunao, Iloilo found in a sack is positive for sexual abuse. The finding is based on the medico-legal or autopsy report of the Lambunao Police.

title: 20,800 individuals affected by Uwan receive help from GMA Kapuso Foundation
summary: A total of 20,800 individuals affected by Super Typhoon Uwan received help from GMA Kapuso Foundation.

title: Teenager rescues over 50 people in Liloan, Cebu amid Typhoon Tino
summary: Fifteen-year-old Jayboy Magdadaro came to the rescue of over 50 people in Barangay Jubay, Liloan, Cebu, who needed help navigating the floodwaters brought on by rains from Typhoon Tino last week.

title: Complaint filed vs Cebu officials in alleged foreign trips during Tino
summary: Complaint filed vs Cebu officials in alleged foreign trips during Tino

title: Taal Volcano had minor phreatomagmatic eruption
summary: A minor phreatomagmatic eruption was reported in Taal Volcano on Wednesday morning, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) said.

title: Cebu provincial gov't lifts suspension of classes
summary: The Cebu provincial government has lifted the suspension of classes in all levels, following the recommendation of the Department of Education (DepEd) and the Provincial Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Office (PDRRMO).

title: 2 Abra cops dead in shooting incident over 'misunderstanding'
summary: Two cops died in a shooting incident at the provincial EOD and canine unit in Bangued, Abra due to a misunderstanding on November 10, the Philippine National Police (PNP) said Wednesday.

title: Gov"t kicks off efforts to restore schools in typhoon-hit Negros Occidental
summary: The Department of Education (DepEd), together with local and national agencies, has begun relief and recovery operations in Negros Occidental following the extensive damage caused by Typhoon Tino last week.

title: Agri losses from Uwan reach P188.27M -- DA
summary: The devastation wrought by Super Typhoon Uwan has so far caused P188.27 million in agricultural losses in the country based on initial estimates, the Department of Agriculture (DA) reported on Wednesday.

title: Rare Hawksbill turtle found dead off Zamboanga
summary: A critically endangered Hawksbill sea turtle was found dead in the waters off Zamboanga City Port, the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) reported on Wednesday.

title: Illegal logging blamed for Cagayan flooding amid Uwan
summary: Residents of Tuao, Cagayan, have blamed illegal logging and the lack of flood control projects in their area after floodwaters carrying logs destroyed many houses during the onslaught of Super Typhoon Uwan.

title: Uwan"s storm surges rob Catanduanes seaside residents of homes
summary: Several residents of Barangay Tubli, a coastal community in Caramoran, Catanduanes, no longer have safe shelters where they can rest their weary bodies after storm surges from then Super Typhoon Uwan swept away their houses.

title: 4.5M impacted by Uwan--OCD
summary: At least 4.5 million people across 11,100 barangays nationwide have been affected or displaced by Super Typhoon Uwan, the Office of Civil Defense (OCD) reported Wednesday evening.

title: Fire hits residential area in Antipolo
summary: A fire broke out in a residential area in Barangay San Roque, Antipolo City on Wednesday evening.

title: Bolinao, Pangasinan drug bust nets 2 drug suspects, P13.6M in shabu
summary: Two suspected drug peddlers were arrested in a buy-bust operation in Bolinao, Pangasinan on Wednesday that also yielded two kilos of suspected shabu worth P13.6 million, the Philippine National Police"s Drug Enforcement Group said.

title: 70% of power in La Union restored 3 days after Uwan
summary: Power supply in La Union is being restored steadily three days after Super Typhoon Uwan battered the province and left most areas without electricity.
